Dear Mrs. Waller:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on August 24-
28 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 284-9720.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12404 Placement.
(6) Before the placement of a child, the agency shall
document preparation, regardless of the child's age, that
explains all of the following to all relevant parties:
(a) The circumstances necessitating placement.
(b) The child’s individual needs.
(c) Any special problems presented.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not have the above information documented before the
placement of the child.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(f) Notification to the parents, referral source, lawyer
guardian ad litem, and courts when applicable, of the
change in placement.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three did not
notify one or all of the above parties before a change of
placement. The foster child moved to a CCI.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(g) Information about the child was shared with the new
placement, consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
4

Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not provide the new placement with the information consistent
with the requirements of 400.12417.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
(b) Child’s date of birth.
(c) Available known information about the child’s health.
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors relating
to the care of the child.
(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(g) Circumstances necessitating placement or replacement
of the child.
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent
to provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the
foster child and the foster family, including information
about siblings who do not reside in the foster home.
(i) Name of assigned social service worker.
(j) Authorization to provide routine and emergency medical
care.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not provide the above information in an agency document or the
DHHS-3307 to the relevant parties before the placement of the
foster child.
R 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(b), shall include all of the following
information:
(e) A plan which includes any changes made since the
previous plan and which has the content specified in R
400.12419.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not include changes to the service plan. Goals were noted as
accomplished although there was no summary to provide
reasoning for the goal change. Updates did not include action
steps that were completed.
5

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy FOM 722.03 page 14-16 Placement exception request (PER) – Was a
PER completed when required and completed quarterly.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two out of three foster care files did not have a
PER completed when necessary. A residential PER is still in pending status. A Sib split
per has not been completed to date.
DHHS Policy FOM 722-08C Page 2 Required Participation in Development - Foster
Parent / Caregiver
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three did not have the caregivers
signature on the PATP.
DHHS Policy FOM 722-08C Page 2 Required Participation in Development - Parents
and Youth over 14-Years Old
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three did not have the signature of the
youth over 14.
DHHS Policy FOM 722-06I Page 11-12 SIBLING VISITATION AND ONGOING
INTERACTION
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did not have a sibling visit
documented.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: Staff culture
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
6

There were 0 incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were 0 incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Renewal 2019 CAP has been completed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
